law.text: No contractor shall deviate from the provisions, plans or specifications upon which a contract has been awarded without first having obtained written authority from the department to do so. If the contractor does deviate without such authority, neither the State of Kentucky, the Department of Highways, the Finance and Administration Cabinet nor the State Treasurer shall pay or be liable for any work or material not fully provided for in the original contract.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4356t-3f.
